attributes.action: Refund 30% of Tuition fees for 2020/2021 academic year
attributes.additional_details: It is unreasonable for an institution to demand the same price for a completely different product regardless of the circumstances. Students' mental health has also declined and Universities have offered little to no support and instead offered low-quality online education that benefitted few to none.
attributes.background: The government must demand universities and institutions to refund 30% of whatever a student paid during the 2020/2021 academic year due to our lost experiences.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament is responsible for.

Decisions about refunding students are a matter for individual universities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to directly reimburse students for a proportion of their tuition fees, or reduce student loan debts, if that's something you'd like to happen.
